Name: man
Description: The `man` command displays online manual documentation pages.

Arguments.Name: a
Arguments.Description: Display all manual pages instead of just the first found for each page argument.

Arguments.Name: d
Arguments.Description: The `-d` argument provides extra debugging information when used with the specified command.

Arguments.Name: f
Arguments.Description: Emulate the functionality of the `whatis` command within the `man` utility.

Arguments.Name: h
Arguments.Description: Display a short help message and exit.

Arguments.Name: k
Arguments.Description: The `-k` argument command in the `man` tool displays manual pages that match a given keyword or regular expression.

Arguments.Name: m
Arguments.Description: The `-m` argument allows for overriding default architecture and machine settings for platform-specific manual page lookup.

Arguments.Name: o
Arguments.Description: Forces the use of non-localized manual pages, overriding specific environment variables.

Arguments.Name: p
Arguments.Description: The `-p` argument allows the use of specified preprocessors before running certain commands.

Arguments.Name: t
Arguments.Description: The `-t` argument processes the manual page source for transformation into other formats.

Arguments.Name: w
Arguments.Description: Displays the location of the manual page instead of its contents.
